article.title: Configuration of JPA Security
article.para: JPA Security is configured via the persistence properties in your persistence.xml. Below is a list of persistence properties that are supported out of the box by JPA Security.

listitem.para: net.sf.jpasecurity.persistence.provider - This is the only property that is required by JPA Security. It specifies the class name of the original persistence provider that shall be used by JPA Security to do the actual database access.
net.sf.jpasecurity.security.authentication.provider - This property specifies the class name of the implementation of an authentication provider.
net.sf.jpasecurity.security.rules.provider - This property specifies the class name of the implementation of an access rules provider.
